japanese: うーん、パッと思いつくのはそれくらいかな。
translation:
Well, off the top of my head,
that's all I can think of.

japanese:
ふむふむ、参考になります。
ありがとうございます。
translation:
Hmm, I see. That's quite helpful.
Thank you very much.

japanese: ２人でなんの話をしてるんだ？
translation: What are the two of you talking about?

japanese:
なっ！？
う、上杉君！？
translation:
Wha?!
U-Uesugi-kun?!

japanese: い、いつから……そこにいたんですか？
translation: Wh-when did you...get here?

japanese:
いや、いま来たところだが。
なんだよ、聞かれたくない話をしてたのか？
translation:
Just now.
What's going on? Were you talking about something
you don't want to be overheard?

japanese: そ、そそ、そんなことありませんよぉ？
translation: N-n-n-not at all, you know?

japanese: めちゃくちゃ動揺してんじゃねぇか。
translation: You totally just freaked out, though.

japanese:
してません！
ただ軽い世間話を楽しんでいただけです！
translation:
I didn't!
We were just having a casual conversation!

japanese:
そうやって否定すればするほど
墓穴を掘ることになるぞ？
translation:
The more you deny it,
the more you dig your own grave, you know?

japanese: うう……。
translation: Ooohh...

japanese:
もう隠せなさそうだし、
言っちゃってもいいんじゃないかな？
translation:
Well, since it seems like we can't hide it anymore,
is it okay if we tell him?

japanese: らいはちゃん……。
translation: Raiha-chan...

japanese:
いや、まあ、本当に言いたくないなら
言わなくてもいいぞ？
translation:
Well, I mean, if you really don't want to,
you don't have to say anything.

japanese: そういうわけでは……。
translation: That's not it...

japanese: 頑張って、五月さん！
translation: You can do it, Itsuki-san!

japanese:
上杉君が好きなものや、欲しがりそうなものを
らいはちゃんに教えてもらっていたんです。
translation:
I was having Raiha-chan tell me
what you like or would want.

japanese: ……俺の？
お兄ちゃん、反応薄くない？
translation: Big bro, aren't you reacting a bit too calmly?

japanese:
いや、そう言われても。
なんでだ？
translation:
Well, even if you say that, 
why do you want to know, Itsuki?

japanese:
むう……。
わざと言ってます？
translation: Mmh... Are you saying that on purpose?

japanese: わざとじゃない、本当にわからないんだが。
translation: It's not on purpose, I honestly don't know.

japanese: お兄ちゃんって鈍感。
translation: You're so insensitive, big bro.

japanese: は？
translation: Huh?

japanese: 五月さん、これはちゃんと言わないと無理っぽいよ。
translation: Itsuki-san, you should tell him the reason why.

japanese:
……理由なんて１つだけです。
もうすぐ、あなたの誕生日ですから。
translation:
...There's only one reason.
Your birthday is coming up soon.

japanese:
お兄ちゃんにどんなプレゼントを渡すのがいいか、
相談にのってたんだ。
translation:
I was asking Raiha-chan for advice
on what kind of present to give you.

japanese:
そ、そういうことか。
なんかすまん、空気読めてなかったな。
translation:
I-I see.
Sorry, I wasn't reading the atmosphere at all.

japanese:
今更ですし、こうなった以上、
本人に聞くことにします。
translation:
Now that it's out in the open,
I'll just ask you directly.

japanese: 今年の誕生日プレゼントはなにがいいですか？
translation:
What kind of present
would you like for your birthday this year?

japanese: そうだな――
translation: Let's see%p-2;――

japanese:
（欲しいもの……。
　急に聞かれると、これと言って思いつかねぇ）
translation:
(Something I want...
 I can't think of anything off the top of my head.)

japanese: ……なんでもいい。
translation: ...Anything is fine.

japanese:
お兄ちゃーん。
夕ご飯のメニューじゃないんだからね？
translation:
Big brooo...
This isn't the dinner menu, you know?

japanese:
いえ、こちらも……すみません。
本人に聞くことではありませんし。
translation:
No, I'm...sorry, too.
I shouldn't have asked you point blank.

japanese:
でも、本当に困ってしまって。
男性に贈り物をするなんて経験がないんです。
translation:
But, I'm really at a loss here.
I have no experience giving gifts to men.

japanese:
いや、俺にくれただろ。
去年の誕生日。
translation:
Well, you've given one to me before.
Last year for my birthday.
Ah...

japanese:
そうですけど、あれはちょっと違うんです。
私が言いたいのは、そういうことではなくて……。
translation:
Yes, but that was a little different.
What I mean is that...

japanese: （……どういうことなんだ？）
translation: (...What does she mean?)

japanese: お兄ちゃんもさ、他人事じゃないよね。
translation: This involves you directly, big bro.

japanese:
別に気負わなくていい。
お前があげたいもので俺は構わない。
translation:
You really don't need to worry about it.
I don't mind whatever you want to give me.

japanese: ですが、せっかくなら喜んで欲しいのです。
translation: But, I want you to be happy about it.

japanese:
そうなると、男性は
どういったものがいいのかと迷ってしまって。
父に聞こうかとも考えたのですが……。
translation:
And then I started to wonder
what kind of things men would like.
I even thought about asking Dad...

japanese: それは止めてくれ。
translation: Please don't.

japanese: で、ですよね。
translation: I-I won't.

japanese: お兄ちゃんもさ、他人事じゃないよね。
translation: This involves you directly, big bro.

japanese: じゃあ俺が……。
translation: Then, I...

japanese:
はい、その……特別な贈り物という意味では、
上杉君に贈るのが初めてなんです。
translation:
Yes, well... It's just that it's the first time
I'm giving something to you 
that has a special meaning, Uesugi-kun.

japanese:
だから悩んでしまって。
できれば喜んで欲しいし、
あなたの好きなものにしたいから。
translation:
So, I'm having trouble deciding.
I want you to be happy,
and I want it to be something you like.

japanese: ……そうか。
translation: ...I see.

japanese: お兄ちゃん、嬉しそう。
translation: Big bro, you look happy.
Ooh...

japanese: お兄ちゃんもさ、他人事じゃないよね。
translation: This involves you directly, big bro.

japanese: まあ、もらう側なわけだしな。
translation: Well, because I'm the one receiving the gift, you know.

japanese: そういう意味じゃなくてー。
translation: That's not what I meant, though.

japanese:
お兄ちゃんの誕生日が終わったら、
次は五月さんの誕生日だよ？
translation:
After your birthday is over, big bro,
it'll be Itsuki-san's birthday next, won't it?

japanese:
お兄ちゃんも、どんなプレゼントにするか
ちゃんと考えておかないと。
translation:
Big bro, you should think about
what kind of present to get her too.

japanese: （そうか、こいつらの誕生日は５月５日だった！）
translation: (Oh, right. Their birthdays are on May 5th!)

japanese:
（付き合い初めて最初の誕生日プレゼント。
　そう思うと確かにめちゃくちゃ悩ましい……！）
translation:
(This will be Itsuki's first birthday present
 since we started to date.
 It's definitely a tough decision...!)

japanese: あ、悩んでる悩んでる。
translation: Ah, you're worrying, aren't you?

japanese: ……五月の気持ちがよくわかった。
translation: ...I now understand exactly how you feel, Itsuki.

japanese:
でしょう？
簡単には決められません。
translation:
Right?
It's hard to make such a decision so easily.

japanese:
ぐぬぬぬ……。
あっという間に誕生日がきちまいそうだ。
translation:
Ugghh...
Your birthday will be here before I know it.

japanese:
あなたは聞かないんですか？
私の欲しいもの。
translation:
Don't you want to know
what I want as a present?

japanese: ああ、聞くつもりはない。
translation: No, I don't plan on asking.

japanese:
自分で答えを出したいんだよ。
そうやって悩み抜いて選んだものなら、
お前がどんな反応をしても後悔しないからな。
translation:
I want to figure it out for myself.
If I choose something after struggling with it,
then I won't regret whatever reaction you give.

japanese: また、あなたに教えられてしまいました。
translation: Once again, you've taught me something.

japanese: ん？
translation: Hm?

japanese:
私もギリギリまで悩もうと思います。
きっと素敵な物を選んでみせますから
楽しみにしていてくださいね？
translation:
I'll struggle with it until the last minute too.
I'll choose something wonderful,
so please look forward to it.

japanese:
俺もだ。
お前が喜ぶものを選んでみせる。
楽しみにしててくれ。
translation:
Same goes for me. I'll choose something
that will make you happy.
You better get excited.

japanese: はい！
translation: Okay!
